summary: The bill, titled the "Strengthen and Tackle Opportunities to Prevent Violence Act of 2025" (or STOP Violence Act of 2025), amends the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968. It aims to provide additional grant amounts, specifically $20,000,000, to states, local governments, and nonprofit organizations. These funds would be used for victim compensation, training, and technical assistance to public assembly facilities to prepare for and protect against mass violence. The bill defines "mass violence," "active shooter," "targeted violence," and "public assembly facility."
